alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving storm producing heavy rain will impact portions of east central Forsyth County through 445 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kernersville, or 10 miles east of Winston-Salem. This storm was nearly stationary. Kernersville has already received up to an inch of rain in the past hour. HAZARD...Multiple rounds of storms have produced heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may cause isolated flooding especially in poor drainage locations. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kernersville, Walkertown and Sedge Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
